description: A personal project management app specifically designed for procrastinators, focusing on psychological barriers, motivation, and breaking down overwhelming tasks into manageable pieces.
targetAudience: Individuals who struggle with procrastination, perfectionism, and task paralysis
corePrinciplesAndGoals: Reduce friction to starting tasks through micro-steps
Provide immediate dopamine hits for small wins
Eliminate guilt and shame from the UX
Work with human psychology, not against it

userStories.title: Task Breakdown Assistant
userStories.description: As a procrastinator, I want an AI assistant that automatically breaks down overwhelming tasks into tiny, non-threatening steps (2-5 minutes each) so I can overcome the initial resistance to starting.
acceptanceCriteria: User can input a large task (e.g., 'Write research paper')
System suggests 5-10 micro-steps with time estimates
Each step is small enough to feel achievable (2-5 min)
User can accept, reject, or modify suggested steps
System saves breakdown for later reference
userStories.notes: Core feature - essential for reducing overwhelm

userStories.title: The 2-Minute Rule Button
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see only the absolute next smallest action I can take right now, with a prominent '2-Minute Start' button that commits me to just 2 minutes of work.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows ONE primary action at a time
Large, friendly 'Just 2 Minutes' button
Timer automatically starts when clicked
After 2 minutes, gentle prompt: 'Keep going?' or 'Great job! Done for now?'
No guilt messaging if user stops after 2 minutes
Celebrates the completion regardless of continuation
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Friction reducer - makes starting feel safe

userStories.title: Progress Visualization & Dopamine Hits
userStories.description: As a procrastinator, I want immediate visual feedback and rewards for tiny actions so my brain gets the dopamine it craves and motivates me to continue.
acceptanceCriteria: Visual progress bar that fills with each micro-step
Satisfying animations/sounds when completing steps
Streak counter for consecutive days with any progress
Achievement badges for patterns (e.g., '5 First Steps', 'Morning Warrior')
Before/after view showing cumulative progress over time
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Motivation engine - brain rewards system - COMPLETE

userStories.title: Anti-Perfectionism Mode
userStories.description: As a perfectionist procrastinator, I want a 'Good Enough' mode that actively encourages imperfect action over perfect inaction.
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle 'Good Enough Mode' that changes UI messaging
Replaces 'Complete' with 'Done (for now)'
Shows quotes/mantras about imperfect action
Allows marking tasks as '80% is victory'
Hides quality/rating metrics that trigger perfectionism
userStories.notes: Perfectionism is a major blocker for many procrastinators - COMPLETE

userStories.title: Procrastination Pattern Insights
userStories.description: As a user, I want to understand my procrastination patterns (when, why, what types of tasks) so I can work with my tendencies rather than against them.
acceptanceCriteria: Tracks which tasks get delayed and by how long
Identifies patterns: time of day, task type, emotional state
Weekly insight report: 'You avoid creative tasks on Mondays'
Suggests optimal timing for different task types
Non-judgmental tone in all insights
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Context Preservation
userStories.description: As a user who gets interrupted, I want the app to remember exactly where I was and what I was thinking so I can resume without the mental cost of context switching.
acceptanceCriteria: Quick note field for 'What I was about to do next'
Auto-saves location in documents/links
Shows 'Last time you were...' when resuming
Suggested next action based on previous session
Timeline view of work session for memory trigger
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Emotion-First Task Sorting
userStories.description: As a procrastinator, I want to sort my tasks by how I feel right now (energized, anxious, creative, brain-dead) rather than traditional priority.
acceptanceCriteria: Current mood/energy selector on dashboard
Tasks tagged with required energy type (focus, creative, mundane)
Smart filter shows tasks matching current state
Suggests break or easier alternative when low energy
Learns from user's completion patterns

userStories.title: Procrastination-Friendly Reminders
userStories.description: As a user, I want reminders that are encouraging and understanding rather than guilt-inducing, with easy snooze options that don't make me feel worse.
acceptanceCriteria: Reminder tone options: encouraging, neutral, humorous (never harsh)
Smart snooze with reason capture: 'Not now because...'
Learns from snooze patterns to adjust timing
No notification spam that trains user to ignore
Celebration when user acts on reminder
userStories.notes: Nice to have - many users disable all reminders

userStories.title: Emergency Deadline Mode
userStories.description: As a procrastinator facing an imminent deadline, I want an emergency mode that helps me triage and execute under pressure without judgment.
acceptanceCriteria: One-click 'Emergency Mode' button
Rapid assessment: 'What's actually due? What can be cut?'
Shows only essential tasks with time-boxing
Pomodoro timer with breaks enforced
Post-crisis reflection: 'What could prevent this next time?'

userStories.title: Accountability Partner Integration
userStories.description: As a procrastinator, I want to optionally share specific tasks with an accountability partner who can send gentle check-ins without judgment.
acceptanceCriteria: User can designate accountability partners
Share specific tasks (not entire list) with chosen partner
Partner receives gentle notification: 'X is working on Y today'
Partner can send encouragement messages
No shame-based notifications
userStories.notes: Social accountability for those who want it

technicalConsiderations: Cross-platform: Web, iOS, Android for maximum accessibility
Fast load times (< 1 second) to reduce friction
Accessible design for users with ADHD/anxiety
successMetrics: User completes at least one micro-step per day (7-day streak rate)
Time from task creation to first action taken
Task completion rate (even partial completion counts)
Number of 2-minute sessions that extend longer
appOverview: Personal AI assistant for project management focused on overcoming procrastination. Users define high-level personal goals (e.g., "Be a better husband", "Be a better parent"). App decomposes goals into projects, tasks, and micro-tasks. Guides execution with anti-procrastination mechanics. Keeps user moving via nudges, momentum, and accountability.
coreFeatures: Onboarding: User enters high-level goals, app suggests breakdown, selects daily triggers, requires accountability buddy.
Goal & Project Management: Support multiple projects, AI-driven decomposition, progressive disclosure.
Micro-Task Engine: 'Break this' button generates tiny steps, streak-based leveling.
Progress Visualization: Bold progress bar, completion rewards.
Trigger & Routine System: Anchor tasks to habits, learn trigger timing.
Focus Mode: One-tap full-screen lock, ambient sounds, emergency exit.
Accountability: Buddy pings, virtual body doubling.
Timing & Insights: Shadow timer, pre-task display, daily voice recap.
Public Commitment: One-tap share to anonymous wall or socials.
Forgiveness & Reset: Missed day gentle reset.
Adaptive Nudges: Visual shrinking ring countdown, optional voice reminder.

Anti-Perfectionism Mode: Toggle that changes UI messaging, replaces 'Complete' with 'Done (for now)', displays encouraging quotes/mantras, lets users mark tasks as '80% is victory', hides rating metrics that trigger perfectionism.
Emergency Deadline Mode: One-click activation for imminent deadlines, rapid triage to identify essential tasks, time-boxing with Pomodoro timers, enforced breaks, post-crisis reflection prompt.

Procrastination-Friendly Reminders: Tone options (encouraging, neutral, humorous), smart snooze with reason capture, learns from snooze patterns, celebrates when user acts, no guilt-inducing messages.
Accountability Partner Integration: Gentle notifications like 'X is working on Y today', user-selected partners can send encouragement, no shame-based alerts.
